results.title: Felodipine compared to nifedipine as "third-line drug" in resistant hypertension.
results.text_hl: This study appraised, therefore, the therapeutic utility of twelve months' treatment with @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ 20-60 mg twice daily in 55 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with previous @<m>DISEASE_Drug_Resistant_Epilepsy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000069279 @@@drug-resistant hypertension@@@ who had been successfully treated for the previous year with @CHEMICAL_Felodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015736 @@@felodipine@@@ 5-20 mg twice daily, each @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ antagonist being used in combination with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 100 mg daily with or without @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ 25 mg daily.

citations.NLM: Maclean D, Mitchell ET, Readman AS. Felodipine compared to nifedipine as "third-line drug" in resistant hypertension. Angiology. 1986 Nov;37(11):840-5. PMID: 3789464
